line.comment: * Chooses the leading Battlegroup (champion), then the sector target. Then fills up with other member Battlegroups at similar jump distance like the champion. Then starts the operation.
* returns FALSE if the chosen operation type is currently not possible. Returns the target sector if a CI could be started.
* minimum power rating of individual Battlegroups
* minimum power rating for the entire operation. The default 2000 points equal a combat strength of 4x M2 destroyers
* CI type

line.text: ' candidates to expand them into clusters'

line.comment: * creating a list of potential target sectors
* Xenon sectors adjacent to the OCV portal
* important player Outposts
* half levelled up ship/station production specialization
* ship component storage
* many bonus perks
* many factories
* best production
* best research
* energy hubs
* mining hubs
* bottlenecks inside player faction
* the $targets array is still empty if border sectors was our only restriction
* from here on we only ever remove targets !
* unknown sectors never need to be invaded with this kind of firepower
* remove not claimable sectors
* distance of the target sector to each of our sectors divided by their total number. (we can only target in our general sphere of influence)
* we can also go for less valuable enemy enclaves because they are often poorly defended
* which is our most powerful Battlegroup?
* remove too weak Battlegroups

line.text: ' Battlegroups which would be strong enough / the champion is in: '

line.comment: * our target sector is often the one closest to the champion
* some types of CIs are very picky. This greatly reduces our sector target selection and we never want weak factions to send their fleets too far away
* if we only target sectors which are in general proximity to the rest of our empire we can send our fleets a bit further than that, but not across the entire galaxy
* for the more aggressive types of CIs we actually want longer range to be more likely

line.text: ' is too distant / their champion BattleGroup is '

line.comment: * safety check. we always want our CI to be at least twice stronger than all current enemies in target sector

line.text: ' CI target sector current hostile power: '

line.comment: * now begin to filll up with other Battlegroups which are at same jump distance as our champion so that nobody arrives at his standby position at vastly different times
* we can repeat this as long as there are still valid battlegroups left to fill the operation with
* is the CI filled up with enough power yet?
* once we have at least our minimum power we randomly stop to add more squadrons
* the more defensive CIs are much more likely to fill up further
* always likely to use extra power against the player
* after we added all BGs which are at same jump distance as the champion we start expanding our search band around the target sector to fill the CI with more BGs
* got enough power now?
* **BEGIN operation
* 0 = no CI active , 1 = positioning phase , targetsector = invasion phase
* target sector
* member array, including the CI leader
* potential rally jumpgates must lead straight into the target sector
* each member BG gets its closest possible rally jumpgate and the sector saved as local variable (these also get handed over should a leader switch happen)
* an active rallyGate variable blocks retreat checks (Mayhem.Squadron.AssessRetreat) and changes general fleet behavior (Mayhem.Task.Squadron.BattleGroup)
* we stop any retreating
* restart each member squadron
* if player gets targeted everyone pities him and allows to sign truces again

Chooses the leading Battlegroup (champion), then the sector target. Then fills up with other member Battlegroups at similar jump distance like the champion. Then starts the operation.
returns FALSE if the chosen operation type is currently not possible. Returns the target sector if a CI could be started.
minimum power rating of individual Battlegroups
minimum power rating for the entire operation. The default 2000 points equal a combat strength of 4x M2 destroyers
CI type

from here on we only ever remove targets !
unknown sectors never need to be invaded with this kind of firepower

distance of the target sector to each of our sectors divided by their total number. (we can only target in our general sphere of influence)
we can also go for less valuable enemy enclaves because they are often poorly defended
which is our most powerful Battlegroup?
remove too weak Battlegroups
our target sector is often the one closest to the champion
some types of CIs are very picky. This greatly reduces our sector target selection and we never want weak factions to send their fleets too far away
if we only target sectors which are in general proximity to the rest of our empire we can send our fleets a bit further than that, but not across the entire galaxy
for the more aggressive types of CIs we actually want longer range to be more likely
safety check. we always want our CI to be at least twice stronger than all current enemies in target sector
now begin to filll up with other Battlegroups which are at same jump distance as our champion so that nobody arrives at his standby position at vastly different times
we can repeat this as long as there are still valid battlegroups left to fill the operation with
is the CI filled up with enough power yet?
once we have at least our minimum power we randomly stop to add more squadrons
the more defensive CIs are much more likely to fill up further
always likely to use extra power against the player
after we added all BGs which are at same jump distance as the champion we start expanding our search band around the target sector to fill the CI with more BGs
got enough power now?
**BEGIN operation
0 = no CI active , 1 = positioning phase , targetsector = invasion phase
target sector
member array, including the CI leader
potential rally jumpgates must lead straight into the target sector
each member BG gets its closest possible rally jumpgate and the sector saved as local variable (these also get handed over should a leader switch happen)
an active rallyGate variable blocks retreat checks (Mayhem.Squadron.AssessRetreat) and changes general fleet behavior (Mayhem.Task.Squadron.BattleGroup)
we stop any retreating
restart each member squadron
if player gets targeted everyone pities him and allows to sign truces again
